description.narrative: 1) To improve effectiveness and efficiency of commercial justice systems in the management of commercial disputes by improving the capacity of judicial officers to solve commercial disputes, enhancing the Judiciary's ability to use ICT for the administration of commercial disputes and by improving the capacity to institute and use alternative dispute resolution (ADR) mechanisms by judges, magistrates, tribunal members and ADR practitioners. 2) To improve confidence of the private sector in the commercial justice system by enhancing the capacity of the Business Court Users Committee (BCUC) to hold commercial justice institutions accountable and to contribute to the development of policies and processes for improved investment, trade, and commercial dispute resolution.

Direct beneficiaries: The private sector, commercial court judges and magistrates, legal researchers, women ADR practitioners, Tax Appeal Tribunal, Public Procurement and Oversight Review Board, competent authority, competition tribunal, Business Premises and Rent tribunal, cooperatives tribunal, Small Claims Court, National Council on Administration of Justice, Judiciary Training Institute, Nairobi Centre for International Arbitration, Judiciary ICT department, Court Annexed Mediation Secretariat, Mediation Task Force, BCUC, Micro and Small Medium enterprises. Indirect beneficiaries: Business Regulatory Reforms Unit at the Ministry of East Africa Affairs, Mediators, Arbitrators, Adjudicators, Performance Measurement and Management Directorate.
The project aims to improve business and investor confidence in the judicial system in Kenya.
